{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2970347,"name":"Zack Inventor","username":"ZBoss","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-10-03T00:05:32.299Z","cooked":"

Hello,

My team is CADing a practice robot for our offseason. In our design, we use 1/4 inch polycarbonate.

I’m relativity new to FIRST and am wondering where is the best place to buy 1/4 inch polycarbonate that is matte black.

Thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2021-10-03T11:08:03.244Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":465,"reads":536,"readers_count":535,"score":2447.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":396346,"topic_slug":"where-to-buy-polycarbonate","display_username":"Zack Inventor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/where-to-buy-polycarbonate/396346/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2970348,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-03T00:08:42.845Z","cooked":"

To my knowledge there are no easily accessible suppliers of matte black polycarb. Your best bets are glossy black or dark tinted.

Here’s a link for tinted.

Here’s a link for glossy.

It’s also worth noting that some/most polycarb sold as 1/4" is more like .236" and you should be prepared to adjust for that.

Polycarb by it’s nature is shiny so a matt color would take special finishing ie $$$
When I want a color I just paint the backside.
Check with local plastic suppliers for off cuts.

You’re going to have a lot of trouble finding black polycarb sheet. As far as I know, the best you can do is smoke grey, and even that’s not matte. If you really need black, I’d suggest using a different plastic sheet, maybe a strong acrylic like Kydex or an acetal. Both can be had in black and the acetal is only sort-of glossy. Regardless, the place to go for plastics is U.S. Plastic. They have pretty much anything that you could find elsewhere, good prices, and excellent shipping. We use them for all our plastics.

That’s pretty thick (1/4") for polycarb in FRC – there are places to use this for sure, but you might be surprised how much it weighs. You can often get by with thinner material, but this might be exactly right for what you are doing. You can pocket is, etc. But check into thickness before you buy.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2021-10-03T01:29:14.008Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":435,"readers_count":434,"score":117.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":396346,"topic_slug":"where-to-buy-polycarbonate","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/where-to-buy-polycarbonate/396346/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2970359,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-10-03T03:21:09.663Z","cooked":"

You are best off starting by calling the various plastics suppliers that are accessible to you and asking what they regularly keep in stock. Anything else will be a special order and will probably be subject to Minimum Order Qualities (MOQ) that can be quite large i.e. 20 4 ft x 8 ft sheets. Your team should then design using the materials available.

Does your team have the manufacturing/machining capabilities to work with such thick material to the tolerances needed for your design? Your team should also be tailoring their designs to match the manufacturing capabilities available.

The matte black finish you want would be more easily achieved through a secondary process rather than as a material property.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2021-10-03T03:21:09.663Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":408,"readers_count":407,"score":86.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":396346,"topic_slug":"where-to-buy-polycarbonate","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/where-to-buy-polycarbonate/396346/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2970365,"name":"chrisrin","username":"chrisrin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chrisrin/{size}/160418_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-03T03:42:12.945Z","cooked":"
Strategic:

suggest using a different plastic sheet

Since polycarb’s glossy by default, I agree it’ll be easier to pick another plastic. HDPE and ABS sheet both commonly come in a slightly textured more matte looking black sheet (+ they’re a little cheaper). Look up HDPE black marine board. If it has to be polycarb, then you could research how to transform glossy black to matte via sanding. Or you could research how to hot dye clear polycarb with idye poly (but then you likely still need to sand - seems like a lot of work when there are easier options). Or there are matte paints that bond well to polycarb & that apparently don’t chip much at all. I personally wouldn’t go the paint route though.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2021-10-03T03:42:12.945Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":365,"readers_count":364,"score":118.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":396346,"topic_slug":"where-to-buy-polycarbonate","display_username":"chrisrin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/where-to-buy-polycarbonate/396346/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2970368,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-03T04:24:31.391Z","cooked":"

Or acetal homopolymer

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2021-10-03T04:24:31.391Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":396346,"topic_slug":"where-to-buy-polycarbonate","display_username":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28219,"username":"chrisrin","name":"chrisrin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chrisrin/{size}/160418_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":4999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cynicism isn't wisdom"},"post_url":"/t/where-to-buy-polycarbonate/396346/9","custom_user_title":"Cynicism isn't wisdom","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2970369,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-10-03T04:25:56.413Z","cooked":"
chrisrin:

Or there are matte paints that bond well to polycarb & that apparently don’t chip much at all. I personally wouldn’t go the paint route though.

There are paints meant to work on the polycarb bodies of RC cars that can be found at the hobby supply shops that serve that market. I recall something about using the wrong type of paint on polycarb can damage it but don’t recall the details.

Or a black sticker sheet.

Idk about matte black, but Boedecker Plastics in Texas is a good source for many plastics and Polycarbonate, including 1/16" grey tinted. For convenience, McMaster-Carr is good and depending on the size, the cost is sometimes only marginally more than other suppliers.

amazon.com

We use 1/4" polycarbonate for gearboxes; works very well! Regular flange bearings go into it very nicely. Its pretty hefty for general use, but if you need more toughness (like an intake that gets run into things), it can be a good step up from 1/8" or from Aluminum.

I was in at Home Depot today looking for a project window.
I ended up with acrylic-it will be okay for this. Lexan was just not available in larger sizes.

Surprised me.

We use HDPE a lot for things like belly pans, but it is a bit less rigid than polycarb or acetal. It does come in a nice matte black, though. We tend to buy the 0.25" recycled black HDPE from U.S. Plastics, which is nice both because it’s good material and it’s recycled, which makes me feel a bit better about using it.

By the way, all the links in my original post were to material that was as close to 1/4" as you can get (the smoke grey polycarb is actually 0.22", while the Kydex and acetal are both 0.25".)

Wow, thank you for all the knowledge.

I believe I misspoke when I mentioned “matte black” polycarb. I was referring to the color used on the cheezy’s robot. Now I know that the color is “smoke grey.”

Thank you.

I’m not sure where you are, but if you are in the midwest, you should check out ALRO Plastics. In the link I did a quick search for 0.236 sheet polycarbonate and clicked on “drops” section. But as others have said 0.236 is really really thick.

https://www.myalro.com/SearchResultsD.aspx?PT=Plastics&SelGridPt=0263&SelGrade=%20&SelShape=S&DimA=0.236&DimB=-3&DimC=-3&len=0

We’ve bought black polycarbonate in 3/16" & 1/4" thicknesses from MSC Direct in prior seasons. I believe they have 1/8" as well, but for thinner we just buy the VEXpro sheets.

I buy most of my material from McMaster Carr. Where I am in SoCal I get it in a day and it’s not expensive. 12x24 is good size for small router table that I have. ABS sheet worked well for us too an is a little lighter than PC.

Clear Polycarbonate Sheet, 12" x 24" x 1/4"

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.
